@Arimnestos As far as REXR being a complementary holding to PLD, I completely agree. I don't own either right now but that arrangement is my intent.

"Since rate cuts could be complete by the end of 2026, REXR can likely refinance its debt at rates similar to its weighted average of 3.8%."I'm not sure when they did their last debt deal, but at current levels, I imagine their looking at something close to 5%. And, I wouldn't count on much improvement as the fed does not control LT rates. The 10 year rose after the recent 50 BP cut.Nevertheless, I agree mostly with the authors conclusions, but would suggest REXR is a completmentary reit. If one already has broad geographic exposure through PLD or FR or even STAG, then REXR makes a lot of sense. I'm long PLD and EGP, but could see adding REXR, at the right price.
